intro: Symplocos sawafutagi var. sawafutagi, commonly known as the Japanese waxleaf evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that remain throughout the year, providing ornamental value in gardens. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, which bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature, attracting birds and other wildlife. Native to Japan, this shrub thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
